verses.verse: Gather yourselves together <S%H7197><s%>, yea <S%H7197><s%>, gather together, O nation <S%H1471><s%> that hath no shame <S%H3700><s%>;

before the decree <S%H2706><s%> bring forth <S%H3205><s%>, before the day <S%H3117><s%> pass <S%H5674><s%> as the chaff <S%H4671><s%>, before <S%H3808><s%> the fierce <S%H2740><s%> anger <S%H639><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> come <S%H935><s%> upon you <S%H3117><s%>, before the day of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>'s anger <S%H639><s%> come upon you <S%H935><s%>.

Seek <S%H1245><s%> ye Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, all ye meek <S%H6035><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>, that have kept <S%H6466><s%> his ordinances <S%H4941><s%>; seek <S%H1245><s%> righteousness <S%H6664><s%>, seek <S%H1245><s%> meekness <S%H6038><s%>: it may be <S%H194><s%> ye will be hid <S%H5641><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>'s anger <S%H639><s%>.

For Gaza <S%H5804><s%> shall be forsaken <S%H5800><s%>, and Ashkelon <S%H831><s%> a desolation <S%H8077><s%>; they shall drive out <S%H1644><s%> Ashdod <S%H795><s%> at noonday <S%H6672><s%>, and Ekron <S%H6138><s%> shall be rooted up <S%H6131><s%>.

Woe <S%H1945><s%> unto the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the sea-coast <S%H1471><s%>, the nation of the Cherethites <S%H3774><s%>! The word <S%H1697><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> is against you <S%H3667><s%>, O Canaan, the land <S%H776><s%> of the Philistines <S%H6430><s%>; I will destroy <S%H6><s%> thee <S%H3427><s%>, that there shall be no inhabitant.
And the sea <S%H3220><s%> - coast <S%H2256><s%> shall be pastures <S%H5116><s%>, with cottages <S%H3741><s%> for shepherds <S%H7462><s%> and folds <S%H1448><s%> for flocks <S%H6629><s%>.

And the coast <S%H2256><s%> shall be for the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%>; they shall feed <S%H7462><s%> their flocks thereupon <S%H1004><s%>; in the houses of Ashkelon <S%H831><s%> shall they lie down <S%H7257><s%> in the evening <S%H6153><s%>; for Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> their God <S%H430><s%> will visit <S%H6485><s%> them <S%H7725><s%>, and bring back their captivity <S%H7622><s%>.

I have heard <S%H8085><s%> the reproach <S%H2781><s%> of Moab <S%H4124><s%>, and the revilings <S%H1421><s%> of the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%>, wherewith they have reproached <S%H2778><s%> my people <S%H5971><s%>, and magnified <S%H1431><s%> themselves against their border <S%H1366><s%>.

Therefore as I live <S%H2416><s%>, saith <S%H5002><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>, the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>, Surely Moab <S%H4124><s%> shall be as Sodom <S%H5467><s%>, and the children <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon <S%H5983><s%> as Gomorrah <S%H6017><s%>, a possession <S%H4476><s%> of nettles <S%H2738><s%>, and saltpits <S%H4379><s%>, and a perpetual <S%H5704><s%> desolation <S%H8077><s%>: the residue <S%H7611><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> shall make a prey <S%H962><s%> of them <S%H3499><s%>, and the remnant of my nation <S%H1471><s%> shall inherit them <S%H5157><s%>.

This shall they have for their pride <S%H1347><s%>, because they have reproached <S%H2778><s%> and magnified <S%H1431><s%> themselves against the people <S%H5971><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%>.

Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> will be terrible <S%H3372><s%> unto them <S%H7329><s%>; for he will famish all the gods <S%H430><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%>; and men shall worship <S%H7812><s%> him <S%H376><s%>, every one from his place <S%H4725><s%>, even all the isles <S%H339><s%> of the nations <S%H1471><s%>.
Ye Ethiopians <S%H3569><s%> also <S%H1992><s%>, ye shall be slain <S%H2491><s%> by my sword <S%H2719><s%>.

And he will stretch out <S%H5186><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> against the north <S%H6828><s%>, and destroy <S%H6><s%> Assyria <S%H804><s%>, and will make <S%H7760><s%> Nineveh <S%H5210><s%> a desolation <S%H8077><s%>, and dry <S%H6723><s%> like the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>.

And herds <S%H5739><s%> shall lie down <S%H7257><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of her <S%H2416><s%>, all the beasts of the nations <S%H1471><s%>: both the pelican <S%H6893><s%> and the porcupine <S%H7090><s%> shall lodge <S%H3885><s%> in the capitals <S%H3730><s%> thereof <S%H6963><s%>; their voice shall sing <S%H7891><s%> in the windows <S%H2474><s%>; desolation <S%H2721><s%> shall be in the thresholds <S%H5592><s%>: for he hath laid bare <S%H6168><s%> the cedar-work <S%H731><s%>.

This is the joyous <S%H5947><s%> city <S%H5892><s%> that dwelt <S%H3427><s%> carelessly <S%H983><s%>, that said <S%H559><s%> in her heart <S%H3824><s%>, I am <S%H657><s%>, and there is none besides me <S%H8047><s%>: how is she become a desolation, a place for beasts <S%H2416><s%> to lie down in <S%H4769><s%>! every one that passeth by <S%H5674><s%> her shall hiss <S%H8319><s%>, and wag <S%H5128><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%>.
